posts.name: Ian Fettes
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone.

Just curious-- does anybody here know how to set the raw RPM for a REV NEO to spin at? I see a bunch of examples that don’t actually explain how to use PID. Also, there’s a subVI in the SPARK MAX API that allows to set the velocity… I’ve tried running that on its own-- won’t spin.

Please help! I’m using FRC LabVIEW and SPARK MAXes as the motor controller.

posts.name: Mark McLeod
posts.cooked:
Probably the best way to start is to try using the example REV provides through a roboRIO with an actual NEO able to spin freely (not trying to drive a robot) and with a little bit of a load like a wheel as a flywheel. Run this as part of a full project with this code in Periodic Tasks.vi Use the Run arrow on Robot Main.vi to execute it on the roboRIO.

REV PID Tuner Example 1853×846 216 KB

REV PID Tuner Example 1853×846 216 KB

REV PID Tuner Example 1853×846 216 KB

You’d need to Open a CAN Spark Max motor in Begin.vi for this.

Start by only modifying the P Gain input (e.g., 1), leaving the other inputs alone. Then move the slider for the setpoint up to a low number, e.g., 1000.

You’ll get a graph of two lines: one line will be your target RPM (setpoint), the other will be your motor is actually doing. See what happens, then try different Setpoints to see how the motor follows the setpoint. Then try playing with the PID Gain to get the actual RPM closer to the setpoint (or target) RPM.

Hi.

Did you ever figure out a solution for this? The example works fine, but implementing it in actual robot code can be different.

(Sorry about the double post, accidentally replied to the thread instead of the poster)

posts.name: Mark McLeod
posts.cooked: Actually, that code is pretty independent of any other code you may have and can drop right into your Periodic Tasks.vi Be sure you don’t define or call that motor anywhere else in your code.
Thanks Mark! I just saw your other similar post where you showed how it’s implemented, which helped a lot.

link_counts.title: How to control shooter rpm with Sparkmax?

posts.cooked:
How do I save the PIDF gains using that SparkMax example code? Whenever I set the gains in the Front Panel, they reset to 0 the next time I open the vi.

Edit: I think I figured it out: Right click on the cluster > Data Operations > Make Current Value Default ?
